content: Lane Palmer Hughston | Goldsmiths, University of London Main menu Staff & students In this section Staff details Position Professor of Mathematics Department Computing Email l.hughston (@gold.ac.uk) Lane is a mathematician who works on quantum informatics and mathematical finance. Lane Hughston is Professor of Mathematics in the Department of Computing at Goldsmiths. His doctorate from the University of Oxford. He has carried out work in general relativity, cosmology, quantum mechanics, statistical mechanics, and a number of different areas of mathematical finance, including interest rates, foreign exchange, inflation, and asset pricing. Lane is a member of the London Mathematical Society, the European Mathematical Society, the American Finance Association, the American Physical Society, and the Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics (SIAM). He is a Fellow of the Institute of Mathematics and its Applications, and is a lifetime member of the American Mathematical Society, the Bachelier Finance Society, and the International Society on General Relativity and Gravitation.
